page.title: 04HIGH OAK FARM HEIGHTINGTON.
page.content: High Oak Farm covers 8o acres.There are 5o calves,for beef,1oo breeding Machiams and Suffolk rams.11ooo laying hens, 3ooo point of lay pullets,they are called Warrow, a French bird. Part of the farm is High Oak Coppice,14 acres. The land mark is 3 Poplar trees,3oo years old. The land is grade 2,it is heavy,stoney with 40 acres of grass. The owner's favourite play place was Areley Wood. He went to school at Heightington Hall,Bliss Gate, Far Forest and Stourport Senior,now known as Lickhill. The owner thinks it is possible that it was a Manor Farm. In 1920-30 it was split up. The existing farm buildings,made from ship timbers of broken boats at Stourport boat-yards,were replaced in 1975.
